intro: Tephrosia coarctata, commonly known as the narrowleaf tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine. Tephrosia coarctata is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it valuable in agricultural systems.
